docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: THE untimely deaths of Len Bias and Don Rogers two years ago focused our attention on the tragic role that substance abuse plays in the lives of performing athletes. The tremendous pressures placed upon them to perform to expectations that are often unrealistic have created circumstances in which athletes frequently turn to drug use either to escape from these pressures or to enhance performance.

headline.main: DRUGS IN COLLEGES: TO TEST OR NOT TO TEST; N.C.A.A. Plan Is Deterrent

byline.original: By JAMES C. PUFFER; James C. Puffer is chairman of the N.C.A.A. competitive safeguards committee, which handles health and safety issues for intercollegiate athletics. He is also head physician for the United States Summer Olympic team. Dr. Puffer practices in the Division of Family Medicine at the U.C.L.A. Medical Center
